text: there's been a sharp rise in diplomatic
tension between China and the UK
following a warning from Beijing that it
won't tolerate any interference in the
affairs of Hong Kong Boris Johnson has
offered a path to British citizenship
for up to three million Hong Kong
residents following the imposition by
China of new security laws the Chinese
say that the British offer amongst two
gross interference and they warn the UK
not to treat China as an enemy the UK
argues that China has gone back on the
agreement signed in 1997 which offered
certain freedoms to Hong Kong people for
50 years our diplomatic correspondent
James Robbins has the latest
when Beijing is determined to silence
all opposition in Hong Kong this is a
powerful new message will write nothing
that could be called subversion the
world already knows the freedoms we want
restored but from the moment China
imposed its security laws and started
fresh waves of arrests Beijing has
become more and more angry at Britain's
response the offer to millions of
Hongkongers of potential escape instead
of arrest the chance to live work and
eventually settle in Britain as citizens
now at China's Embassy in London the
Ambassador has moved to barely veiled
threats Britain he says it's guilty of
gross interference and will be the loser
if it persists so we want to be your
friend
we want to be your partner but if you
want to make China a hostile country you
have to bear the consequences and the
Ambassador also warned Britain about its
future 5g network which promises
superfast connectivity cut the Chinese
giant Huawei out he said and Britain's
entire trading future could be a victim
that Boris Johnson does seem to be
moving away from Huawei on security
grounds talking today about not wanting
the UK vulnerable to a high-risk state
vendor so I asked the Foreign Secretary
where this is all heading the real issue
here is one of trust and where the China
can be trusted to live up to its
international obligations and its
international respond
abilities and that's a message that
we're telegraphing along with many of
our allies and indeed many international
partners around the world to the Beijing
particularly in relation to what we seen
in Hong Kong and in Hong Kong that will
be a very welcome signal to leading
pro-democracy activists three of them
have now appeared in court on charges
related to last year's protests we still
hope to encourage more people continue
to engage in the democracy movement even
they banned my book in public library
they can't ignore and silence the voice
of Hong Kong people with the belief of
Hong Kong people to fight for freedom we
will never give up and surrender to
Beijing with some education officials in
Hong Kong
apparently ordering a purge of reading
material which does not teach students
positively all the signals are of a
crisis in relations between London and
Beijing which is steadily worsening and
James is with me now we heard you there
Jim's asking the Foreign Secretary where
all of this is heading what is your
reading of where it's going well this is
clearly a really important test of will
between Britain a post imperial power
and the power which surely will dominate
if it doesn't already the second part of
this century that is China and I think
we should look for clues as to how both
sides use that offer to thousands
potentially millions of Hong Kongers to
come here if they start to exercise that
power that right how will China respond
I think the other really interesting
thing about today is this all comes at a
time when Dominic Rob was quite
separately making an announcement to the
House of Commons of new British
therefore non-eu targeted sanctions
against 47 named individuals who Britain
holds accountable guilty of gross human
rights abuses now 25 of them from Russia
more surprisingly perhaps 20 from Saudi
Arabia the russians accused of
complicity in the murder of Sergei
Magnitsky the lawyer the Saudis accused
of active complicity in the murder of
Jamel Khashoggi now I particularly asked
the Foreign Secretary of going after
Saudi Arabia risked the potential for
jobs disappearing in Britain we sell so
many arms to Saudi Arabia might there be
a commercial return
he said actually the most important
thing is that we stand up against the
thugs of despots the henchmen and the
killers he took a very high moral
position and if he pursues that in
relation to China that will be really
interesting he was asked by me but
earlier by MPs whether he might move to
name and therefore impose sanctions on
Chinese individuals over their treatment
of the weekers he didn't rule that out
and said that new lists of names were
being drawn up the targeted sanctions
James again many thanks James rom is
there for us our diplomatic
correspondent
